intro: Ithycaulon moluccanum, commonly known as the Moluccan starfruit, is a tropical plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits, which are typically yellow or orange when ripe. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other gourds and melons. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it produces small, yellow flowers. The fruit is edible, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
